description: Multi-List Scoring Framework - Segment-specific rankings using Anna's 24 dish taxonomy

framework_philosophy.principle: Different customer segments need different dish recommendations
framework_philosophy.key_insight_v3.3: Aligned to Anna's 24-dish taxonomy. Three-list approach for Family/Couple/Recruitment priorities.
framework_philosophy.taxonomy: 155 menu items → 58 granular dishes → 24 high-level dish types
framework_philosophy.consistency: All lists use percentile-based 1-5 scoring within their segment

family_performers.description: Best dishes for families with children (on Dinneroo)

kids_happy.rationale: Kids satisfaction is the primary driver for family repeat

fussy_eater_friendly.rationale: Families need dishes that work for picky kids

adult_satisfaction.rationale: Parents need to enjoy it too

portions_adequate.rationale: Family meals need to feed everyone

couple_performers.description: Best dishes for couples/adults without children (on Dinneroo)

adult_satisfaction.rationale: Adult satisfaction is the primary driver

recruitment_priorities.description: Dishes NOT on Dinneroo with highest potential

changelog.v3.3: Three-list approach: Family Performers, Couple Performers, Recruitment Priorities. Aligned to Anna's 24 dish taxonomy.
changelog.v3.2: Renamed 'Opportunity' track to 'Demand'. Added percentile-based scoring.
changelog.v3.1: Removed zone_ranking_strength. Redistributed weight to orders_per_zone.
changelog.v3.0: Unified framework - same 5 factors for cuisine and dish analysis.
